Posted: February 23, 2015
												EDIT 8/26: This game has almost NO active players anymore. If you're ok with playing against bots 'n'♥♥♥♥♥♥ keep reading.This game ♥♥♥♥in ROCKS, lemme tell ya whyPROS:+Bright colors to contrast the Tron-esque world+Good graphics+Great gameplay+More intense dodgeball than middle school+Mustaches+Great offline AI+Leveling doesn't give anyone a significant advantage over anyone, making you rely on skillCONS- Occasional glitch where you'll pick up a ball and it'll immediately go to someone else (Online only)- Occasional glitch where in the Hoops gamemode, the ball will randomly teleport somewhere else (Online only)- There aren't too many songs, and some of them are very long and will get stuck in your head after repeated listens- No percievable advantage to leveling, other than cosmetics- Limited customizationSCORE: 8/10While there are flaws, they're relatively small gripes compared to what the game does right. Pick this up as soon as possible.

												This is a great game. It has great music, gameplay, and graphics. It is like the games of old where you queue up and just play some PVP... but has many ties to new age style and graphics. This is a great game to have on your HD. It will either fill in the gaps when you need breaks from other games or very well can hold its own as a main game. Check it out you will not be let down. The only downside is that Controller funtionality is a little blah. Sometimes when i open the game on my PC it does not recognize that I have an xbox 360 controller connected. It takes multiple restarts to get the game to recognize the controller. The though is an often experienced occurence from many games that say they have controller functionality... So I do not feel it is grounds to not recommend the game and for sure is a fixable issue. So please to check out the game I really enjoyed every second of played game time and think you will too! Happy Gaming!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												An Honest Review:Imagine yourself playing the game you're most addicted to, then multiply that by your age. RR-DDD is one of the most addicting games I've found. If you're not in it for the multiplayer fun, bring some friends over and try tackling your arcade high score. I definitely reccomend a desktop computer equipped with a subwoofer to really pump out the intense tracks this game offers. Not a fan of the music? RR-DDD offers the ability to use your own music to rock out to in .ogg or .wav format (Yes a pain to do, I know, but worth it).To sum up,Pros: An amazing first person dodgeball shooter that has been continously getting updates.Cons: Due to it's Indie-ness the amount of players currently online and locally hosted servers are slim. I usually catch ~30 people on US East

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												I can never decide if I recommend this game or not.I want to love it. I mean, look at that trailer, it's glorious.The actual game is just as awesome as you'd imagine, with a fantastic soundtrack.That said, I absolutely hate playing this game.I've never got a ball when I want/need one, when I finally get a ball half the time I'm hit in the "legs" or otherwised insta-killed from offscreen. When I throw my precious ball, I virtually always miss. My one shot, my one offensive ability, now gone. Not only that, but it was my shield too. My only hope is to dodge or catch everything everything that comes flying my way.The AI is particularly annoying, for running in a straight line toward the nearest dodgeball and then completely whiffing it across the map. Most of the time they don't even try to hit you, it's more like they're trying to play keep-away more than dodgeball. When they randomly flip into "kill mode", they grab a ball and rush you. They'll get right up in your face and tag you around your ball, or right after you throw. They'll grab a ball right as you go to pick it up and then hit you with it. They get so close that the ball bounces off of you and right back into their hands, so they're prepped to kill you again as soon as you spawn.Actually, that's a problem with the game in general. There's spawn protection, but when you/your team die, the other team has time to go collect balls to prepare for your next life. You emerge and have to hunt down a ball, they've already got one and all they have to do is run you down and kill you again.The movement system works well, but it takes some getting used to. It should go without saying that I am not used to it. Instead of moving around the space as you would in a first person shooter, you press the direction you want to move in and you just keep moving that way until you change directions or run into something. It makes sense for the avatars we control, and works pretty well, but if you try to play this like it's a first person shooter and move as such, you're gonna have a bad time.And that's really the crux of it.I want to recommend this to *you*, but *I* have a bad time every single time I boot this game up.On an intellectual level I understand that I'm taking the game too seriously, I'm being too competitive, and I need more practice to become comfortable with the controls. Please stay out of the comment section, there's absolutely nothing you could say about this game that would improve my personal experience with it. I'm not interested in anyone's feedback on my feedback.Just suffice to say that it's a damn fine party game, and you'll probably enjoy it *way* more than I do.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a game where neon colored robots with moustaches roll around and try to blow each other up with dodgeballs.10/10Actually though, theres so much about this game that's great. It plays like a shooter, trying to eliminate other players to gain dominance over a battlefield, but it's so much more than just your run-of-the-mill FPS. The music is great, the stages are creative and really fun to play on, the power-ups add a zany twist to the gameplay that you can't find anywhere else. On the surface this game seems like a big joke (which it kind of is), but once you actually start playing, you realise that it's an actually a really fun, viable game (RRDDD for eSports anyone?), in which you have to be able to predict your enemies every move, as you can only carry one ball at a time and have to scourge the map for a new one if you miss, and taking one blow kills you, no questions asked.Not to mention the community, which is great. You don't see the type of toxic people that show up in games like LOL and most FPS's, just a bunch of good guys having a good time with the game. The lead dev is constantly online, talking to the players and taking their advice on what they think should be in the game.I give this game a 9/10 for the great times it's given me and my friends.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								There's a lot to like about this game. Right off the bat you've got the ridiculous premise with levels that remind me of being a kid and playing laser tag. The robots are surprisingly personable for being robots. Customizing their look is a lot of fun (for me).This offers up a great game to just kill some time with friends, perhaps while drinking. But once you get past the humor and charm of the game there's a very deep and balanced system in play. The game really encourages and rewards skilled players who can do stuff in this game that's way over my head.

Posted: January 16, 2016
												**I bought this game when it was on sale for 2-3$**Disco Dodgeball is an exciting new twist to the FPS family. With plenty of gamemodes and fun music what more could you ask for? Players. That is the biggest downfall in this game, and why I would NOT reccomend it to anyone else. If that changes, absolutely would. This game is a ton of fun and is pretty easy to pick up, but hard to master. Players of all skill will be able to enjoy this game simply because of the different modes and the chaos that can go into a single game.Pros-Easy to pickup-Music is fun-You can change the music with your own-Plethora of modes to choose from-Controls are simple-Bots can be challenging-CraftingCons-Very Limited amount of players-Single player can get old-15$ is too muchIf you are looking for a little more, I encourage you to check out my video review on this game below.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												First ever review on Steam, and it seems appropriate that it be Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball.  I bought this on a whim when I saw the plethora of positive reviews, and didn't regret it for a moment.  This game is absurd in all the best ways.  When I'm not playing this game, I'm usually thinking about playing this game.  It's accessible yet hard to master, unique yet familiar, aesthetically pleasing both in visuals and the soundtrack, and, most importantly of all, it's the most fun I've had in a game in a long time.  Like FPS?  This game is for you.  Like sports games?  This game is for you.  Like neon?  This game is for you.  Like silly looking robots throwing flaming dodgeballs at each other?  You probably don't know it, but you most certainly do.  Do yourself a favor:  buy this game.  God wills it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
												If you arent sold by the name of the game, then I'm not sure how to convince you to get this game, but I'll try.This game is quite simply and very unique, but has almost infinite gameplay time. You can choose from tons of game modes and game types, and you can edit each one however you like. The variety in this game is incredible and is truly an amazing gaming experience. Although its not a game that really has a competitive side of it, once you get a couple of friends to have the game, and you are playing against each other, it gets intense. I really enjoy playing this game, but it appears that most people buy the game, play it for an hour or so and then just stop. But i am telling you now, if you do end up getting this game, that it is worth every single cent. The music in the game is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome and suits the disco theme very well and the overall look of the game, while being simple, is perfect, which lets you play this on whatever computer you may have and still enjoy itAlthough there is no exact goal of this game, you dont need one. You make your own goals. Whether it be completing all the achievements, battling against friends to obtain a higher score than them, or it can just be a game to play when you are bored. This game is brilliant when it is played online with other people, but it also can be played just as well in single-player.I highly recommend this game and will enjoy playing it for many hours to come

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												If you are looking for that competitive, fast-paced type of game to have some good times (alone and with friends), then this may be just what you were looking for. Although the base of the game is dodgeball with unicicle robots, instead of sticking to that, the developers went ahead and squeezed as much as they could from that idea resulting in varied and fun (with "fun" being, of course, relative) matches.What you may like:-The game is extremely competitive with the concept being of the "easy to learn but hard to master" type.-The variety of game modes and maps complemented with Workshop support for BOTH things-The online multiplayer is cleverly designed as you jump from a randomized match to another, wasting as little time as possible-You also get to customize you robot with several items, some of which can be bought on the market or instead, crafted with items you get from random drops. But fear not! These items are purely cosmetic, holding no effect on the gameplay at all.What may put you off:-There is no splitscreen mode which is a shame even for PC. It would be awesome to be able to connect you machine to a bigger screen and play with 2 to 4 people.-The current player count is a bit low. I never had any problems connecting to servers (living in the UTC), but I often find myself playing with mostly bots whenever I connect to a server.-As this is dodgeball, the relatively slow nature of the ball throw, although being part of the fun learning how to predict the opponent's movement, having that combined with the fast movement, makes this what I can only describe as "Lucky Shot Simulator" in many cases.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												A game based on robots, on roller blades, playing dodgeball, while listening to disco dubstep... Awe yeah!!This game is incredibly fun! Mixed with quick reactions, satisfying combos, power-ups, multiplayer, and so much more!-------------This game has matured so much since it's inception, and that makes me happy for the future of it. So much had been changed, but in a good way. It has gotten more involvement, and customization to the game.  I want to say more about how much I love this game, but it's hard to know what stands out as good, without knowing the bad... and there's barely any bad, so it's really good!Fun multiplayer, great game modes, a fantastic game to kill time with, absolutely chaotic maps, and all in all, a VERY fun fast paced game!--------The only complaint that I have, is even with a pretty decent integrated graphics card, or one maybe 6-8 years old will have trouble running this. With quick enough reaction times at least.  I've got a mid range gaming PC, and would recommend somewhere around an  Entry Level  gaming PC. This should be able to run the game at max settings, at 1080p @60fps, to enjoy all the special effects, AND have quick reactions.Hope this helped you in anyway at all, and if you have any questions, please feel free to shoot me a message! Enjoy!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Full disclosure: I know the developer, and I've liked all his stuff since New World Colony, so I'm biased.TL;DR: Fun synaesthetic arena shooter.Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball is a callback to the simple days where you threw sports equipment at your friends' faces. It also harkens back to the days of Quake deathmatches, where frags were uncomplicated and satisfying. But it's also a super sexy synaesthetic, rave experience (the game does a nice job of matching the disco aesthetic with the music) where you're no longer just tossing dodgeballs at your friends' heads, but if you squint a bit, it's like you're throwing your friends' heads at your other friends.Pick it up. You'll be happy you did.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is a game where neon colored robots with moustaches roll around and try to blow each other up with dodgeballs.10/10Actually though, theres so much about this game that's great. It plays like a shooter, trying to eliminate other players to gain dominance over a battlefield, but it's so much more than just your run-of-the-mill FPS. The music is great, the stages are creative and really fun to play on, the power-ups add a zany twist to the gameplay that you can't find anywhere else. On the surface this game seems like a big joke (which it kind of is), but once you actually start playing, you realise that it's an actually a really fun, viable game (RRDDD for eSports anyone?), in which you have to be able to predict your enemies every move, as you can only carry one ball at a time and have to scourge the map for a new one if you miss, and taking one blow kills you, no questions asked.Not to mention the community, which is great. You don't see the type of toxic people that show up in games like LOL and most FPS's, just a bunch of good guys having a good time with the game. The lead dev is constantly online, talking to the players and taking their advice on what they think should be in the game.I give this game a 9/10 for the great times it's given me and my friends.

The game really encourages and rewards skilled players who can do stuff in this game that's way over my head.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
												I can never decide if I recommend this game or not.I want to love it. I mean, look at that trailer, it's glorious.The actual game is just as awesome as you'd imagine, with a fantastic soundtrack.That said, I absolutely hate playing this game.I've never got a ball when I want/need one, when I finally get a ball half the time I'm hit in the "legs" or otherwised insta-killed from offscreen. When I throw my precious ball, I virtually always miss. My one shot, my one offensive ability, now gone. Not only that, but it was my shield too. My only hope is to dodge or catch everything everything that comes flying my way.The AI is particularly annoying, for running in a straight line toward the nearest dodgeball and then completely whiffing it across the map. Most of the time they don't even try to hit you, it's more like they're trying to play keep-away more than dodgeball. When they randomly flip into "kill mode", they grab a ball and rush you. They'll get right up in your face and tag you around your ball, or right after you throw. They'll grab a ball right as you go to pick it up and then hit you with it. They get so close that the ball bounces off of you and right back into their hands, so they're prepped to kill you again as soon as you spawn.Actually, that's a problem with the game in general. There's spawn protection, but when you/your team die, the other team has time to go collect balls to prepare for your next life. You emerge and have to hunt down a ball, they've already got one and all they have to do is run you down and kill you again.The movement system works well, but it takes some getting used to. It should go without saying that I am not used to it. Instead of moving around the space as you would in a first person shooter, you press the direction you want to move in and you just keep moving that way until you change directions or run into something. It makes sense for the avatars we control, and works pretty well, but if you try to play this like it's a first person shooter and move as such, you're gonna have a bad time.And that's really the crux of it.I want to recommend this to *you*, but *I* have a bad time every single time I boot this game up.On an intellectual level I understand that I'm taking the game too seriously, I'm being too competitive, and I need more practice to become comfortable with the controls. Please stay out of the comment section, there's absolutely nothing you could say about this game that would improve my personal experience with it. I'm not interested in anyone's feedback on my feedback.Just suffice to say that it's a damn fine party game, and you'll probably enjoy it *way* more than I do.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
												This is an honestly great game, got it from humble bundle by paying the median average but its something i would have bought alone if i knew how good it was before hand.Its a game where you can just have fun but if youre taking it seriously the skill ceiling is actually legitimately high. Its just like dodgeball but there are some pick ups that spice things up, very similarly to Rocket League.The only thing i felt was lacking after playing it for a good hour straight was that the movement felt a bit off. I do like how they delt with jumping though because in many games players will spam jump to create artifical lag and it messes with the hit boxes, crouching doesnt exist either soo its two major networking issues solved that can make even the greatest games an annoyance to play.The level design is pretty decent and the music is great. I think that for the price of the game its entirely worth purchasing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												RRDDD is a really fun game that is awesome when you're playing against other people. The bot matches are a little rough at times, and arcade can be frustrating, but it's the kind of frustrating that makes you want to get better at the game. Only real complaint that I have is that I hate the amount of paid DLC that the game has. While it isn't a major gripe, I just wish that some of the customization options that the game offers came throughout progression in levels rather than paying for that shiny bumper sticker. Regardless, if you have a few friends online that you want to bash their heads in grade-school style, then get this game and have a blast!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												First off I'll start this review by saying: this game is the meaning behind the name "Panic! At The Disco"!Now that's out of the way I will actually review the game.I saw this game when it was on sale and, after consulting the World Wide Web, I decided to buy it.  I played it for a few hours, instead of doing homework, and I adored this game.  The music is great, the gameplay is great and the graphics look like you're at a monster raving doom party!  This is one of my favourite games ever!  With a kind and supportive community and reflex improving gameplay this should be played by everyone!Pros:-Great music-Fast and action-packed rounds-Great for procrastination use-Interesting Power-ups-Unique graphics-You can make the game play your own music-I can make PATD references-Nice communityCons:-In multiplayer the hits often lag (this makes it unclear if you have hit the opposition or not)-After a while the build-in music can become repetitive-No workshop support-Lack of a tool to make mapsSide Effects:-You may want to smash your keyboard at first, same goes for your mouse!-You may, when dodging dodgeballs, actually duck in real life (this has happened to me)Conclusion:This is a fantastic game!  Just buy it!!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												This is a wonderful 'one-hit-kill' arena shooter with all the intensity of gym class dodgeball, but with robots in place of pimply teenagers. The mechanics have a deceptive depth to them which provides the game with enough skill ceiling to be interesting for a long time, without the need for artificial and grueling grinding for unlocks. You get what you pay for, right out of the box. Play it, it's fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								For those of you looking at this game and thinking about buying it, let me warn you... It is going to take control of you for a very long time to come, in all the right ways. YOU MUST BUY THIS WITH FRIENDS! It is the perfect LAN Party game, the perfect online game, and one of the most fun games on Steam, I♥♥♥♥♥♥you not.It's charming for it's simplicity, it's amazing for the level of skill that you can obtain, and it is a godsend for it's incredible soundtrack. All of the affectionate time put into this is incredible, the levels are well designed, the AI... Well, the AI can get stuck sometimes, but no AI has ever been incredibly perfect, after all, let's be honest here. Even if you buy this alone, my god is it fun to play against the bots, exploring the maps and the best vantage points for watching the mayhem of the incredibly fun to watch, fun to play, fun to listen to, indie game of a long time. I highly recommend this game to any and all that are PC gamers.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2015
												Disco Dodgeball is a really fun game, kind of like Nintendo's Splatoon, but with better music and lots of balls.Two things to note:+  In my limited time with the game, I've not had any trouble finding an online match. People do still play this game. EDIT: Not many, though. AI bots make up the rest of each team.-  The look sensitivity on an xbox360 controller is far too sensitive, even when turned down to 0, making it almost unplayable with a controller. It's on the dev's todo list, but hasn't been fixed yet. I gave up waiting and tried keyboard and mouse instead. Not so easy to rest on your lap when you're playing from the couch, but you get used to it.I wholeheartedly recommend Disco Dodgeball!

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												First I would like to say that I normally do not like first person shooters. With that said, this game is very, VERY fun game to play. It is very fast paced, matches are usually quick and then the teams get switched around again. I like that so the good players aren't on the same team every time, I say this cause I pretty much suck. I still love this game and find it very fun. I also like that it is very casual and light. You can jump in a match, play for 10 minutes then log off. There are also a lot of different matches that can be played, everything from team elimanation to free for all maddness to a twist game combining dodgeball and basketball. If you seen some videos and was thinking this game and looks cool, get it.If you like first person shooters, get it.If you don't like first person shooters, get it.If your looking for a casual you can have fun with after playing hours of something else, get it.If you like having fun, get it, get it, get it, GET IT!!!!!

												Just as amazing as the ridiculous title makes it sound. Fast paced first person dodgeball with awesome music that syncs with the lights on the stages. You can import your own music library too! Easily the best dodgeball game of all time(and thats not just because this is the only one I've played). If you're a fan of arena shooters and are in the mood for something you can just jump in and have fun with this game is perfect. Early Access Review
								So much fun! Of course there are still some issues, but it is very playable. A lot of different game types, from regular deathmatch, eliminaton, getting a ball through a goal, and more. Jumping off a ramp and dunking the ball on an opponent never gets old.  Do a 360 in the air and slam it for a lot of points (Helicopter). Such an original game that seems repetitive but never gets old as you're always trying new things. As a bonus the soundtrack is GREAT and complements the atmosphere perfectly.Get the game, it's cheap, awesome and will only get better towards release.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												Dodgeball is fun.Dodgeball whilst controlling unicycle robots and raving simultaneously and having a monstertruck announcer hype up everything you do is insanely fun.On a more serious (as serious as you can get for this game) note, the game is well built and very well polished overall. There are several game modes ranging from Deathmatches and dodgeball game Elimination to 'Super Ball', where one of you has to keep a golden dodgeball from the other team and keep it away from them as long as possible, whilst your teammates protect you.There are numerous singleplayer modes as well, despite it being mutiplayer focused (as you would expect) and the bots are surprisingly good (or I just suck :P).In terms of skill, the balls move quite slow as projectiles (relative to most twitch-reaction FPS games) and so there is a fair bit of skill leading shots. Not only that, in point-based games, extra points are given for ricochet shots, mid-air shots etc. etc. Also, it does take some getting use to the jump (hold down longer for bigger jump) and the fact you are uncontrollable, movementwise, when airborne (I hope you have decent momentum buddy!). But its not that bad to adjust, and the feeling you get when you do something awesome, intended or not, not matter how much it has happened before, is euphoric. And then you get the monstertruck guy massively hyping you up. Because he's awesome too.There are also powerups, which do various things such as homing shots, jetpacks, fireballs (balls can't be blocked or caught) etc. Because the game wasn't exciting/silly enough already.Its truly is great. Its silly appeal (robot dodgeball robot rave) doesn't seem to wear off, and regardless, it is a well built FPS game. It can appeal to those who are casual or competitive, because everything is a 1-hit KO.Also, robots have mustaches and glasses.tl:dr version: Robots. Dodgeball. Rave. Fun. Monstertruck Announcer. Hype. Awesomeness. Euphoria.I really really hope this game grows a good multiplayer scene, because it deserves it 100%. The dev recognises this and has already tried to help it along as much as possible, with easy to join multiplayer matches.RRDDD (Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball) everyone.(Side note: I have an Alienware laptop: So my laptop follows the colourscheme of the game. My laptop raves whilst running the game. Completely superfluous, but great nonetheless.)

content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												**I bought this game when it was on sale for 2-3$**Disco Dodgeball is an exciting new twist to the FPS family. With plenty of gamemodes and fun music what more could you ask for? Players. That is the biggest downfall in this game, and why I would NOT reccomend it to anyone else. If that changes, absolutely would. This game is a ton of fun and is pretty easy to pick up, but hard to master. Players of all skill will be able to enjoy this game simply because of the different modes and the chaos that can go into a single game.Pros-Easy to pickup-Music is fun-You can change the music with your own-Plethora of modes to choose from-Controls are simple-Bots can be challenging-CraftingCons-Very Limited amount of players-Single player can get old-15$ is too muchIf you are looking for a little more, I encourage you to check out my video review on this game below.


YouTube™ Video: THE MOST COLOURFUL GAME EVER! - Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball Funny moments 

			Views: 24		

			In this video we played Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball team deathmatch against each other. It was really intense and got a close ending :D Hope you guys enjoy! Check out the game now!

												A fun twist on a traditional sport, but is it worth it?Pros:+Workshop+Power ups+Multiple maps+Singleplayer and Multiplayer+Fun+Vibrant colours with flashing lightsCons:-Movement is really floaty and slow especially in jumping-Not very active playerbase (most games will be either fully populated by bots or half by bots. The bots aren't bad,but if you're like me then you don't get the same experience with bots than actual people playing)-Very expensive for what it isFinal Verdict:Way too expensive for what it is, but it is a fun game to play, if you can pick it up on sale. The lack of players is a big factor in how replayable and much enjoyment you will get out of it, but judging for the game alone I give it7/10

												An Honest Review:Imagine yourself playing the game you're most addicted to, then multiply that by your age. RR-DDD is one of the most addicting games I've found. If you're not in it for the multiplayer fun, bring some friends over and try tackling your arcade high score. I definitely reccomend a desktop computer equipped with a subwoofer to really pump out the intense tracks this game offers. Not a fan of the music? RR-DDD offers the ability to use your own music to rock out to in .ogg or .wav format (Yes a pain to do, I know, but worth it).To sum up,Pros: An amazing first person dodgeball shooter that has been continously getting updates.Cons: Due to it's Indie-ness the amount of players currently online and locally hosted servers are slim. I usually catch ~30 people on US East

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												If you are looking for that competitive, fast-paced type of game to have some good times (alone and with friends), then this may be just what you were looking for. Although the base of the game is dodgeball with unicicle robots, instead of sticking to that, the developers went ahead and squeezed as much as they could from that idea resulting in varied and fun (with "fun" being, of course, relative) matches.What you may like:-The game is extremely competitive with the concept being of the "easy to learn but hard to master" type.-The variety of game modes and maps complemented with Workshop support for BOTH things-The online multiplayer is cleverly designed as you jump from a randomized match to another, wasting as little time as possible-You also get to customize you robot with several items, some of which can be bought on the market or instead, crafted with items you get from random drops. But fear not! These items are purely cosmetic, holding no effect on the gameplay at all.What may put you off:-There is no splitscreen mode which is a shame even for PC. It would be awesome to be able to connect you machine to a bigger screen and play with 2 to 4 people.-The current player count is a bit low. I never had any problems connecting to servers (living in the UTC), but I often find myself playing with mostly bots whenever I connect to a server.-As this is dodgeball, the relatively slow nature of the ball throw, although being part of the fun learning how to predict the opponent's movement, having that combined with the fast movement, makes this what I can only describe as "Lucky Shot Simulator" in many cases.

												While playing single player this game is very fun. However, when you get a bunch of your friends together to play this it because one of the most worthwhile games you can own.PROS: - Player can put any music they want into the game for it to play - Great fun for a group of friends or even alone on singleplayer (Arcade) - Graphics are actually quite goodCONS: - The AI can seem a bit too smart at times and can pinpoint EXACTLY where you are going to be - The community for this game seems dead (Which is a shame because the game is SO much fun) - After each round only a small amount of the total amount of powerups are randomly selected, making beatting arcade mode more luck based than skill - Microtransactions for robot customization (MICROTRANSACTIONS ARE CANCER!)

content:
Posted: September 12, 2015
												I love this game. I have played this game for a while, since beta, where every bot quick drawed you with a ball that came out of nowhere within miliseconds of not seeing you having thier back turned. This game is sooooo fun, I love it, it's not your normal first person shooter, its a complex ball throwing game where you have to determine the ball drop, the ricochet bounce, when to click to catch something, its super fun! I love the new arcade features too, with the power ups and shop upgrades between levels, the slo mo when you kill enemy bots is super cool too, with the music pulsing, the bots slo, you can get tons of kills, and it looks super cool, because slo mo. The multi player powerups are also super cool, yes, it has bugs. Does that make it unplayable? no. Is it a little annoying yes, but the devs are still working on it taking out any bug they find. I highly recommend this game, it's super fun, super cool, and super fun again.

Posted: September 23, 2015
												I wish I could pick a more in the middle recommendation instead of just 'yes' or 'no.' The game is really well put together. The music is great. The concept is simple and easy to pick up. It's fun and a great time waster. That being said the mechanics of the game often fail. I don't know if it's intentional, but there are some aspects that just don't work right. The movement and catching mechanics are extremely off, rarely working the right way, which causes some frustration. That, combined with the low replay value, I'm 100% sure it's not worth the full price. I got it when it was 60% off, so I was more or less okay with paying for what I got. It's by no means a casual game. It requires a lot of skill--especially if you want to overcome the game design oversights.

												When I saw the demo of this game I had to try it out, because I love dodgeball games (Super Dodgeball for the NES is one of my favourite (NES) games ever, so ... yeah ...). Well, I immediately fell in love with this game, not only because it is a really good dodgeball game, but also because it reminded me of Unreal Tournament 2004 mods, heck RRDDD has even something similar to UT04's mutator. Also, should you not like dodgeball it also comes with racing gamemodes and basketball gamemodes!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30
												Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball. A.K.A the original Rocket LeagueThis game can be expressed in many words. You know the feeling you get from playing a gameof Ana paintball? Multiply that and expand: High-octane, Fun, Friendly, Rage-inducing,Satisfying, severe BS, Hilarious, Falling off your seat, and more.Pros:Good graphicsClient-side soundtrack (you can switch songs in the game using B and N. the sountrack affectsthe arena look)Soundtrack composed by multiple artists (totally worth getting)Surprisingly non-toxic crayons- i mean community (must be from playing this game)Bot customization (don’t bother with the store the community market is better.)Bragging rights with loot (mission badges are so cool)Many Gamemodes for single and multi-player. (if you host a server you get to tweak it and youcan become host if the host leaves)Competent botsThe dodgeballs actually look better in game than on the trailersPowerupsSteam Trading cardsCommunity DiscordCheap priceDoes Elimination better than OverwatchA good Rocket league for those that don’t have high specsKudos (complement your eliminator with K to publicly say in chat “Nice shot” in a way)Stattrak Awps- i mean Skillshots. When you get a STATBRAG and get a shot using that kind (IEricochet) it displays the total number of ricochets that you’ve achieved to both you and yourvictimPro and Con: trading card badge gives you an exp bonus so semi “pay to rank up”ConsWeak air strafing (this game throws quake movement ideas out the window, you move andactually slide a little)Weak jumping (maybe it’s just me)Catches are high skill required (but soooo satisfying)Balls have the ability to ricochet so often you might get killed by a bounceNo voice chat (but you wouldn’t want to inturrupt the music would you?)Controller support: you’ll need to set that sensitivity down LOW to play well.This game feels clunky when used with controllers and/or a small screen for local co-op.Great for friends and friendly gamesEpileptics go home this is not for you985/1000

Posted: September 19, 2015
												This game is exactly what it sets out to be.  Robots rolling around in a disco arena playing dodgeball.  At first the controls may feel a little 'weird' if you're used to other FPS games, but after just a minute or two you should be able to sink straight into them.  While this game does support a controller, you definitely want to play it with a keyboard and mouse for that added twitch factor.  It's fast paced, fun that's quick and easy to get into.  Highly recommend this game for both single and multiplayer.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
												Just as amazing as the ridiculous title makes it sound. Fast paced first person dodgeball with awesome music that syncs with the lights on the stages. You can import your own music library too! Easily the best dodgeball game of all time(and thats not just because this is the only one I've played). If you're a fan of arena shooters and are in the mood for something you can just jump in and have fun with this game is perfect. It's easy to pick up and play and also has surprising depth for a dodgeball game. The only concern you should have with experiencing this game is that every real life game of dodgeball you play in the future will eventually turn into a roller skate rave.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												This game is honestly one of the most addicting I've ever played. It's a very fun game that allows you to play how you want with easy customisation and lots of gamemodes and many achievements to keep you busy. I would definitely get this game if you like simple, fun, fast-paced arena shooters, because those the best words to describe it: Simple, Fun and Fast-PacedPros:- Easy to follow tutorials and welcoming for new players.- Games are always balanced.- Controls are simple.- Free-for-All as well as Team settings.- Games can be quick or long.- Controls are simple.- Addictive- Lots of gamemodes- Tons of achievements, especially for a pretty new game.- Unlike most games, bots are fun to play with and against.- Fun to play against friends.Cons:- A few glitches here and there. Sometimes I bump into platforms and get stuck until I get killed.- Movement can be trippy. It can be hard to stop at times.- Small community at the moment.- Sometimes, the catch mechanic doesn't work.- Sometimes, my team always just takes the dodgeballs and miss everyone on the other team, leaving us defenseless.- Some gamemodes are hard to comprehend.- Bad spawns, especially in elimination when six people come out of spawn at the same time and it's survival of the fittest.- The difficulty settings are trash. "Easy" is fun, yet still challenging, I would recommend sticking with that one. "Medium" is terrible. Your teammates hog the balls, everybody on the other team has it out for you, even if you're at the bottom of the scoreboard, and it seems like the bots have aim-bot sometimes (that seems obvious, but still).Anyways, despite it's faults, this game is great when you play it how you want to. I rate it 9/10 and I recommend it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												This game is extremely fun to play, especially if you like throwing dodgeballs into enemies and watching them blow up into pieces.The main solo gamemode is arcade, which alone is really fun. Complete rounds of different stagess in the game with each round having three waves of enemies each. Preform trick shots such as helicopter, godlike, catch, long distance to gather money to spend on awesome abilities like extra ricochets for balls, slow motion when trying to catch the dodgeballs and many, many more. The multiplayer is pretty much empty at this point though. Although there is some people playing multiplayer, you need to be on at the right time and be open to play most gamemodes (its normally team elimination though). There is also a large assortment of gamemodes that can be played on multiplayer or singleplayer bot matches that are also really fun. Hoops combines a basketball aspect into the game, having the players throw the golden ball through the enemy hoop to gain points. Horde mode faces players against an endless wave of bots that won't rest untill you are defeated. There are also many other gamemodes like elimination, team elimination, grand prix, bonus ball, and some others.Overall, this game is really fun to play, however don't count on the multiplayer to have loads of active players and be prepared to fill some of the empty slots with bots. This game is well worth its price.

Posted: February 25, 2015
												This is a wonderful 'one-hit-kill' arena shooter with all the intensity of gym class dodgeball, but with robots in place of pimply teenagers. The mechanics have a deceptive depth to them which provides the game with enough skill ceiling to be interesting for a long time, without the need for artificial and grueling grinding for unlocks. You get what you pay for, right out of the box. Play it, it's fun.

												This game is pretty good :) . Good music, simple gameplay, easy and fast to setup, start and get into, works on low end hardware and is pretty addictive. The only downsides are the rather low amount of maps and the low amount of players that are actually playing. Most of the time you'll just be alone playing against a few bots. Besides that, it's definitely worth a buy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've been putting off getting this game for way to long. Grabbed it the other day after playing the demo (which includes the multiplayer btw). All I can say is I havn't been happier with a game purchase in a long time. So heres a quick break down as to why.Pros:-The music is fantastic lots of high energy up beat techno that feels right at home in this game (Also the levels will pulse with color in time with the music.-Controls are very responsive and simple. also Your robot will keep moving until you break or change direction. allowing you to look around with changing direction.-Very polished, More so then most finished AAA games.-Free demo that allows you to play multiplayer-Full custom keybinding-Tons of levels-Tons of modes (TDM, CTF, Keep away, derby race, basketball, horde, endless tournament and more)-Mustasches -Loads of trick shots and combos-Excellent dodgeball mechanics-Power ups (boomerang ball, fireball, big ball, jetpack, lazor ball and so on.)-Is 'joy inducing' a feature i can point out?-All the other excellent stuff i can't even think ofCons:-Your not playing it yetI have 600-some games on my steam acct. This one, This one right here is one of my new favorite games of all time. You are doing yourself and Gaming as a medium a huge disservice by not buying this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												First ever review on Steam, and it seems appropriate that it be Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball.  I bought this on a whim when I saw the plethora of positive reviews, and didn't regret it for a moment.  This game is absurd in all the best ways.  When I'm not playing this game, I'm usually thinking about playing this game.  It's accessible yet hard to master, unique yet familiar, aesthetically pleasing both in visuals and the soundtrack, and, most importantly of all, it's the most fun I've had in a game in a long time.  Like FPS?  This game is for you.  Like sports games?  This game is for you.  Like neon?  This game is for you.  Like silly looking robots throwing flaming dodgeballs at each other?  You probably don't know it, but you most certainly do.  Do yourself a favor:  buy this game.  God wills it.

								Just 2hrs of play time so far but already had tons of fun!Haven't really found any cons yet, except the inability to find and join public servers. Supposedly it does work though, depending on the time you join. Just buy it while it's still in early access at a lower price, you'll most likely not regret it.

												This game is frankly amazing. The soundtrack couldn't possibly fit any better, the level designs are fun and functional. This is like the funnest take on Quake you could imagine, mixed with a community that seems mostly friendly and mature. The number of game modes is far beyond what I could have guessed a 'dodgeball' fps could implement, and they are implemented well. The arcade mode is even entertaining. Way better than a q3 solo play. Worth every penny. Honestly, buy the 4 pack and make 3 other people very happy.
